creator: gorjy@mail.bg
text:
I have installed Subversion 1.3.0, in order to test it, on a PC with Windows
2003 Server and Apache 2.0.55.0. The PC is on intranet.
 Have modified the httpd.conf file as follows:
...
LoadModule dav_module modules/mod_dav.so
LoadModule dav_svn_module modules/mod_dav_svn.so
LoadModule authz_svn_module modules/mod_authz_svn.so

...
<Location /repos>
 DAV svn
 SVNPath F:\SVN130
 AuthType Basic
 AuthName "Testing Subversion 1.3.0"
 AuthUserFile  F:\SVN130\conf\pass
 AuthzSVNAccessFile F:\SVN130\conf\uAccess
 Require valid-user
</Location>

 The file "pass" is a simple file containing:  username:<MD5 coded password>

 When I start the Apache server, it starts OK.
 When I stop it, for about 5 seconds uses as much as 40% of the CPU and
then crashes. In the event log there are messages saying:
 "Faulting application Apache.exe, version 2.0.55.0, faulting module libapr.dll,
 version 0.9.7.0, fault address 0x00004902."

What could be the problem and how could I fix it?
Any suggestions will be appreciated.

Give us a backtrace, perhaps from Dr. Watson.  You can download and add the
  -symbols.zip files containing all the .pdb diagnostic files so we can see
  exactly what functions crashed here.
creator: wrowe@apache.org

text: Given six weeks, no longer expecting feedback from user.  Closing.
creator: wrowe@apache.org
